summary: This is a cover email from an Assistant United States Attorney to Judge Nathan's chambers, submitting a joint letter from the parties in United States v. Maxwell (20 Cr. 330) that provides a list of names and places for voir dire. It indicates procedural coordination between the prosecution and defense ahead of jury selection.

persons.name: Nathan
persons.context: The email is addressed to Judge Nathan's chambers, indicating she is the presiding judge in the case United States v. Maxwell.

persons.name: Maxwell
persons.context: The case is United States v. Maxwell, indicating Ghislaine Maxwell is the defendant.

connections.description: Judge Nathan is the presiding judicial officer over the criminal case against Maxwell.

events.title: Submission of Joint Letter for Voir Dire
events.description: The parties (prosecution and defense) in United States v. Maxwell submitted a joint letter providing a list of names and places to be used during jury selection (voir dire).

locations: One Saint Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: The document is a procedural filing in the criminal case United States v. Maxwell (20 Cr. 330).
The parties jointly submitted a list of names and places for voir dire, indicating coordination on jury selection issues.
The filing was made by an Assistant United States Attorney from the Southern District of New York.
The attached letter dated November 14, 2021, contains the actual list of names and places, which is not included in this cover email.
